title: Amazon DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX)
description: DAX is a managed caching service engineered for Amazon DynamoDB. DAX dramatically speeds up database reads by caching frequently-accessed data from DynamoDB, so applications can access that data with sub-millisecond latency. You can create a DAX cluster easily, using the AWS Management Console. With a few simple modifications to your code, your application can begin taking advantage of the DAX cluster and realize significant improvements in read performance.

Cluster.description: Contains all of the attributes of a specific DAX cluster.

ActiveNodes.description: The number of nodes in the cluster that are active (i.e., capable of serving requests).

ClusterArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the cluster.

ClusterDiscoveryEndpoint.description: The configuration endpoint for this DAX cluster, consisting of a DNS name and a port number. Client applications can specify this endpoint, rather than an individual node endpoint, and allow the DAX client software to intelligently route requests and responses to nodes in the DAX cluster.

ClusterName.description: The name of the DAX cluster.

IamRoleArn.description: A valid Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies an IAM role. At runtime, DAX will assume this role and use the role's permissions to access DynamoDB on your behalf.

NodeIdsToRemove.description: A list of nodes to be removed from the cluster.

NodeType.description: The node type for the nodes in the cluster. (All nodes in a DAX cluster are of the same type.)

Nodes.description: A list of nodes that are currently in the cluster.

NotificationConfiguration.description: Describes a notification topic and its status. Notification topics are used for publishing DAX events to subscribers using Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS).

ParameterGroup.description: The parameter group being used by nodes in the cluster.

PreferredMaintenanceWindow.description: A range of time when maintenance of DAX cluster software will be performed. For example: sun:01:00-sun:09:00. Cluster maintenance normally takes less than 30 minutes, and is performed automatically within the maintenance window.

SecurityGroups.description: A list of security groups, and the status of each, for the nodes in the cluster.

Status.description: The current status of the cluster.

SubnetGroup.description: The subnet group where the DAX cluster is running.

TotalNodes.description: The total number of nodes in the cluster.

Cluster.title: Cluster

ClusterAlreadyExistsFault.description: You already have a DAX cluster with the given identifier.
ClusterAlreadyExistsFault.title: ClusterAlreadyExistsFault

ClusterNotFoundFault.description: The requested cluster ID does not refer to an existing DAX cluster.
ClusterNotFoundFault.title: ClusterNotFoundFault

ClusterQuotaForCustomerExceededFault.description: You have attempted to exceed the maximum number of DAX clusters for your AWS account.
ClusterQuotaForCustomerExceededFault.title: ClusterQuotaForCustomerExceededFault

AvailabilityZones.description: The Availability Zones (AZs) in which the cluster nodes will be created. All nodes belonging to the cluster are placed in these Availability Zones. Use this parameter if you want to distribute the nodes across multiple AZs.

ClusterName.description:
The cluster identifier. This parameter is stored as a lowercase string.

Constraints:

  • A name must contain from 1 to 20 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.

  • The first character must be a letter.

  • A name cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

IamRoleArn.description: A valid Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies an IAM role. At runtime, DAX will assume this role and use the role's permissions to access DynamoDB on your behalf.

NodeType.description: The compute and memory capacity of the nodes in the cluster.

NotificationTopicArn.description:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to which notifications will be sent.

The Amazon SNS topic owner must be same as the DAX cluster owner.

ParameterGroupName.description: The parameter group to be associated with the DAX cluster.

PreferredMaintenanceWindow.description:
Specifies the weekly time range during which maintenance on the DAX cluster is performed. It is specified as a range in the format ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi (24H Clock UTC). The minimum maintenance window is a 60 minute period. Valid values for ddd are:

  • sun

  • mon

  • tue

  • wed

  • thu

  • fri

  • sat

Example: sun:05:00-sun:09:00

If you don't specify a preferred maintenance window when you create or modify a cache cluster, DAX assigns a 60-minute maintenance window on a randomly selected day of the week.

ReplicationFactor.description:
The number of nodes in the DAX cluster. A replication factor of 1 will create a single-node cluster, without any read replicas. For additional fault tolerance, you can create a multiple node cluster with one or more read replicas. To do this, set ReplicationFactor to 2 or more.

AWS recommends that you have at least two read replicas per cluster.

SecurityGroupIds.description:
A list of security group IDs to be assigned to each node in the DAX cluster. (Each of the security group ID is system-generated.)

If this parameter is not specified, DAX assigns the default VPC security group to each node.

SubnetGroupName.description:
The name of the subnet group to be used for the replication group.

DAX clusters can only run in an Amazon VPC environment. All of the subnets that you specify in a subnet group must exist in the same VPC.

Tags.description: A set of tags to associate with the DAX cluster.

Cluster.description: A description of the DAX cluster that you have created.

Description.description: A description of the parameter group.

ParameterGroupName.description: The name of the parameter group to apply to all of the clusters in this replication group.

ParameterGroup.description: Represents the output of a CreateParameterGroup action.

Description.description: A description for the subnet group

SubnetGroupName.description: A name for the subnet group. This value is stored as a lowercase string.

SubnetIds.description: A list of VPC subnet IDs for the subnet group.

SubnetGroup.description: Represents the output of a CreateSubnetGroup operation.

AvailabilityZones.description: The Availability Zone(s) from which to remove nodes.

ClusterName.description: The name of the DAX cluster from which you want to remove nodes.

NewReplicationFactor.description: The new number of nodes for the DAX cluster.

NodeIdsToRemove.description: The unique identifiers of the nodes to be removed from the cluster.

Cluster.description: A description of the DAX cluster, after you have decreased its replication factor.

ClusterName.description: The name of the cluster to be deleted.

Cluster.description: A description of the DAX cluster that is being deleted.

ParameterGroupName.description: The name of the parameter group to delete.

DeletionMessage.description: A user-specified message for this action (i.e., a reason for deleting the parameter group).

SubnetGroupName.description: The name of the subnet group to delete.

DeletionMessage.description: A user-specified message for this action (i.e., a reason for deleting the subnet group).

ClusterNames.description: The names of the DAX clusters being described.

MaxResults.description:
The maximum number of results to include in the response. If more results exist than the specified MaxResults value, a token is included in the response so that the remaining results can be retrieved.

The value for MaxResults must be between 20 and 100.

NextToken.description: An optional token returned from a prior request. Use this token for pagination of results from this action. If this parameter is specified, the response includes only results beyond the token, up to the value specified by MaxResults.

Clusters.description: The descriptions of your DAX clusters, in response to a DescribeClusters request.

NextToken.description: Provides an identifier to allow retrieval of paginated results.

The value for MaxResults must be between 20 and 100.

Provides an identifier to allow retrieval of paginated results.

Parameters.description: A list of parameters. Each element in the list represents one parameter.

The maximum number of results to include in the response. If more results exist than the specified MaxResults value, a token is included in the response so that the remaining results can be retrieved.

SourceType.description: The event source to retrieve events for. If no value is specified, all events are returned.

ParameterGroups.description: An array of parameter groups. Each element in the array represents one parameter group.

The maximum number of results to include in the response. If more results exist than the specified MaxResults value, a token is included in the response so that the remaining results can be retrieved.

Source.description: How the parameter is defined. For example, system denotes a system-defined parameter.

NextToken.description: Provides an identifier to allow retrieval of paginated results.

Parameters.description: A list of parameters within a parameter group. Each element in the list represents one parameter.

SubnetGroupNames.description: The name of the subnet group.

NextToken.description: Provides an identifier to allow retrieval of paginated results.

SubnetGroups.description: An array of subnet groups. Each element in the array represents a single subnet group.

Endpoint.description: Represents the information required for client programs to connect to the configuration endpoint for a DAX cluster, or to an individual node within the cluster.

Address.description: The DNS hostname of the endpoint.

Port.description: The port number that applications should use to connect to the endpoint.

Endpoint.title: Endpoint

Event.description: Represents a single occurrence of something interesting within the system. Some examples of events are creating a DAX cluster, adding or removing a node, or rebooting a node.

Date.description: The date and time when the event occurred.

Message.description: A user-defined message associated with the event.

SourceName.description: The source of the event. For example, if the event occurred at the node level, the source would be the node ID.

SourceType.description: Specifies the origin of this event - a cluster, a parameter group, a node ID, etc.

Event.title: Event

AvailabilityZones.description: The Availability Zones (AZs) in which the cluster nodes will be created. All nodes belonging to the cluster are placed in these Availability Zones. Use this parameter if you want to distribute the nodes across multiple AZs.

ClusterName.description: The name of the DAX cluster that will receive additional nodes.

NewReplicationFactor.description: The new number of nodes for the DAX cluster.

Cluster.description: A description of the DAX cluster. with its new replication factor.

InsufficientClusterCapacityFault.description: There are not enough system resources to create the cluster you requested (or to resize an already-existing cluster).
InsufficientClusterCapacityFault.title: InsufficientClusterCapacityFault

InvalidARNFault.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) supplied in the request is not valid.
InvalidARNFault.title: InvalidARNFault

InvalidClusterStateFault.description: The requested DAX cluster is not in the available state.
InvalidClusterStateFault.title: InvalidClusterStateFault

InvalidParameterCombinationException.description: Two or more incompatible parameters were specified.
InvalidParameterCombinationException.title: InvalidParameterCombinationException

InvalidParameterGroupStateFault.description: One or more parameters in a parameter group are in an invalid state.
InvalidParameterGroupStateFault.title: InvalidParameterGroupStateFault

InvalidParameterValueException.description: The value for a parameter is invalid.
InvalidParameterValueException.title: InvalidParameterValueException

InvalidSubnet.description: An invalid subnet identifier was specified.
InvalidSubnet.title: InvalidSubnet

InvalidVPCNetworkStateFault.description: The VPC network is in an invalid state.
InvalidVPCNetworkStateFault.title: InvalidVPCNetworkStateFault

NextToken.description: An optional token returned from a prior request. Use this token for pagination of results from this action. If this parameter is specified, the response includes only results beyond the token.

ResourceName.description: The name of the DAX resource to which the tags belong.

NextToken.description: If this value is present, there are additional results to be displayed. To retrieve them, call ListTags again, with NextToken set to this value.

Tags.description: A list of tags currently associated with the DAX cluster.

Node.description: Represents an individual node within a DAX cluster.

AvailabilityZone.description: The Availability Zone (AZ) in which the node has been deployed.

Endpoint.description: The endpoint for the node, consisting of a DNS name and a port number. Client applications can connect directly to a node endpoint, if desired (as an alternative to allowing DAX client software to intelligently route requests and responses to nodes in the DAX cluster.

NodeCreateTime.description: The date and time (in UNIX epoch format) when the node was launched.

NodeId.description: A system-generated identifier for the node.

NodeStatus.description: The current status of the node. For example: available.

ParameterGroupStatus.description: The status of the parameter group associated with this node. For example, in-sync.

Node.title: Node

NodeNotFoundFault.description: None of the nodes in the cluster have the given node ID.
NodeNotFoundFault.title: NodeNotFoundFault

NodeQuotaForClusterExceededFault.description: You have attempted to exceed the maximum number of nodes for a DAX cluster.
NodeQuotaForClusterExceededFault.title: NodeQuotaForClusterExceededFault

NodeQuotaForCustomerExceededFault.description: You have attempted to exceed the maximum number of nodes for your AWS account.
NodeQuotaForCustomerExceededFault.title: NodeQuotaForCustomerExceededFault

NodeTypeSpecificValue.description: Represents a parameter value that is applicable to a particular node type.

NodeType.description: A node type to which the parameter value applies.

Value.description: The parameter value for this node type.

NodeTypeSpecificValue.title: NodeTypeSpecificValue

NotificationConfiguration.description: Describes a notification topic and its status. Notification topics are used for publishing DAX events to subscribers using Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS).

TopicArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the topic.

TopicStatus.description: The current state of the topic.

NotificationConfiguration.title: NotificationConfiguration

Parameter.description: Describes an individual setting that controls some aspect of DAX behavior.

AllowedValues.description: A range of values within which the parameter can be set.

ChangeType.description: The conditions under which changes to this parameter can be applied. For example, requires-reboot indicates that a new value for this parameter will only take effect if a node is rebooted.

DataType.description: The data type of the parameter. For example, integer:

IsModifiable.description: Whether the customer is allowed to modify the parameter.

NodeTypeSpecificValues.description: A list of node types, and specific parameter values for each node.

ParameterType.description: Determines whether the parameter can be applied to any nodes, or only nodes of a particular type.

Source.description: How the parameter is defined. For example, system denotes a system-defined parameter.

Parameter.title: Parameter

ParameterGroup.description: A named set of parameters that are applied to all of the nodes in a DAX cluster.

Description.description: A description of the parameter group.

ParameterGroupName.description: The name of the parameter group.

ParameterGroup.title: ParameterGroup

ParameterGroupAlreadyExistsFault.description: The specified parameter group already exists.
ParameterGroupAlreadyExistsFault.title: ParameterGroupAlreadyExistsFault

ParameterGroupNotFoundFault.description: The specified parameter group does not exist.
ParameterGroupNotFoundFault.title: ParameterGroupNotFoundFault

ParameterGroupQuotaExceededFault.description: You have attempted to exceed the maximum number of parameter groups.
ParameterGroupQuotaExceededFault.title: ParameterGroupQuotaExceededFault

ParameterGroupStatus.description: The status of a parameter group.

NodeIdsToReboot.description: The node IDs of one or more nodes to be rebooted.

ParameterGroupName.description: The name of the parameter group.

ParameterGroupStatus.title: ParameterGroupStatus

ClusterName.description: The name of the DAX cluster containing the node to be rebooted.

NodeId.description: The system-assigned ID of the node to be rebooted.

Cluster.description: A description of the DAX cluster after a node has been rebooted.

SecurityGroupMembership.description: An individual VPC security group and its status.

SecurityGroupIdentifier.description: The unique ID for this security group.

Status.description: The status of this security group.

SecurityGroupMembership.title: SecurityGroupMembership

Subnet.description: Represents the subnet associated with a DAX cluster. This parameter refers to subnets defined in Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) and used with DAX.

SubnetAvailabilityZone.description: The Availability Zone (AZ) for subnet subnet.

SubnetIdentifier.description: The system-assigned identifier for the subnet.

Subnet.title: Subnet

SubnetGroup.description:
Represents the output of one of the following actions:

  • CreateSubnetGroup

  • ModifySubnetGroup

Description.description: The description of the subnet group.

SubnetGroupName.description: The name of the subnet group.

Subnets.description: A list of subnets associated with the subnet group.

VpcId.description: The Amazon Virtual Private Cloud identifier (VPC ID) of the subnet group.

SubnetGroup.title: SubnetGroup

SubnetGroupAlreadyExistsFault.description: The specified subnet group already exists.
SubnetGroupAlreadyExistsFault.title: SubnetGroupAlreadyExistsFault

SubnetGroupInUseFault.description: The specified subnet group is currently in use.
SubnetGroupInUseFault.title: SubnetGroupInUseFault

SubnetGroupNotFoundFault.description: The requested subnet group name does not refer to an existing subnet group.
SubnetGroupNotFoundFault.title: SubnetGroupNotFoundFault

SubnetGroupQuotaExceededFault.description: The request cannot be processed because it would exceed the allowed number of subnets in a subnet group.
SubnetGroupQuotaExceededFault.title: SubnetGroupQuotaExceededFault

SubnetInUse.description: The requested subnet is being used by another subnet group.
SubnetInUse.title: SubnetInUse

SubnetQuotaExceededFault.description: The request cannot be processed because it would exceed the allowed number of subnets in a subnet group.
SubnetQuotaExceededFault.title: SubnetQuotaExceededFault

Tag.description:
A description of a tag. Every tag is a key-value pair. You can add up to 50 tags to a single DAX cluster.

AWS-assigned tag names and values are automatically assigned the aws: prefix, which the user cannot assign. AWS-assigned tag names do not count towards the tag limit of 50. User-assigned tag names have the prefix user:.

You cannot backdate the application of a tag.

Key.description: The key for the tag. Tag keys are case sensitive. Every DAX cluster can only have one tag with the same key. If you try to add an existing tag (same key), the existing tag value will be updated to the new value.

Value.description: The value of the tag. Tag values are case-sensitive and can be null.

Tag.title: Tag

TagQuotaPerResourceExceeded.description: You have exceeded the maximum number of tags for this DAX cluster.
TagQuotaPerResourceExceeded.title: TagQuotaPerResourceExceeded

ResourceName.description: The name of the DAX resource to which tags should be added.

Tags.description: The tags to be assigned to the DAX resource.
The list of tags that are associated with the DAX resource.

ResourceName.description: The name of the DAX resource from which the tags should be removed.

TagKeys.description: A list of tag keys. If the DAX cluster has any tags with these keys, then the tags are removed from the cluster.

Tags.description: The tag keys that have been removed from the cluster.

ClusterName.description: The name of the DAX cluster to be modified.

Description.description: A description of the changes being made to the cluster.

NotificationTopicArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the topic.

NotificationTopicStatus.description: The current state of the topic.

ParameterGroupName.description: The name of a parameter group for this cluster.

PreferredMaintenanceWindow.description: A range of time when maintenance of DAX cluster software will be performed. For example: sun:01:00-sun:09:00. Cluster maintenance normally takes less than 30 minutes, and is performed automatically within the maintenance window.

SecurityGroupIds.description: A list of user-specified security group IDs to be assigned to each node in the DAX cluster. If this parameter is not specified, DAX assigns the default VPC security group to each node.

Cluster.description: A description of the DAX cluster, after it has been modified.

ParameterGroupName.description: The name of the parameter group.

ParameterNameValues.description: An array of name-value pairs for the parameters in the group. Each element in the array represents a single parameter.

ParameterGroup.description: The parameter group that has been modified.

Description.description: A description of the subnet group.

SubnetGroupName.description: The name of the subnet group.

SubnetIds.description: A list of subnet IDs in the subnet group.

SubnetGroup.description: The subnet group that has been modified.
